segment.source: How to Create and Use a Project Template
segment.target: How to Create and Use a Project Template

segment.source: How to Create and Use a Project Template
segment.target: How to Create and Use a Project Template

segment.source: How to Create and Use a Project Template
segment.target: How to Create and Use a Project Template

segment.source: You can use an App-V 5.0 project template to save commonly applied settings associated with an existing virtual application package.
segment.target: You can use an App-V 5.0 project template to save commonly applied settings associated with an existing virtual application package.

segment.source: These settings can then be applied when you create new virtual application packages in your environment.
segment.target: These settings can then be applied when you create new virtual application packages in your environment.

segment.source: Using a project template can streamline the process of creating virtual application packages.
segment.target: Using a project template can streamline the process of creating virtual application packages.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can, and often should apply an App-V 5.0 project template during a package upgrade.
segment.target: You can, and often should apply an App-V 5.0 project template during a package upgrade.

segment.source: For example, if you sequenced an application with a custom exclusion list, it is recommended that an associated template is created and saved for later use while upgrading the sequenced application.
segment.target: For example, if you sequenced an application with a custom exclusion list, it is recommended that an associated template is created and saved for later use while upgrading the sequenced application.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 project templates differ from App-V 5.0 Application Accelerators because App-V 5.0 Application Accelerators are application-specific, and App-V 5.0 project templates can be applied to multiple applications.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 project templates differ from App-V 5.0 Application Accelerators because App-V 5.0 Application Accelerators are application-specific, and App-V 5.0 project templates can be applied to multiple applications.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to create and apply a new template.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to create and apply a new template.

segment.source: To create a project template
segment.target: To create a project template

segment.source: To start the App-V 5.0 sequencer, on the computer that is running the sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V 5.0 sequencer, on the computer that is running the sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the virtual application package is currently open in the App-V 5.0 Sequencer console, skip to step 3 of this procedure.
segment.target: If the virtual application package is currently open in the App-V 5.0 Sequencer console, skip to step 3 of this procedure.

segment.source: To open the existing virtual application package that contains the settings you want to save with the App-V 5.0 project template, click FileOpen, and then click Edit Package.
segment.target: To open the existing virtual application package that contains the settings you want to save with the App-V 5.0 project template, click FileOpen, and then click Edit Package.

segment.source: On the Select Package page, click Browse and locate the virtual application package that you want to open.
segment.target: On the Select Package page, click Browse and locate the virtual application package that you want to open.

segment.source: Click Edit.
segment.target: Click Edit.

segment.source: In the App-V 5.0 Sequencer console, to save the template file, click FileSave As Template.
segment.target: In the App-V 5.0 Sequencer console, to save the template file, click FileSave As Template.

segment.source: After you have reviewed the settings that will be saved with the new template, click OK.
segment.target: After you have reviewed the settings that will be saved with the new template, click OK.

segment.source: Specify a name that will be associated with the new App-V 5.0 project template.
segment.target: Specify a name that will be associated with the new App-V 5.0 project template.

segment.source: Click Save.
segment.target: Click Save.

segment.source: The new App-V 5.0 project template is saved in the directory specified in step 3 of this procedure.
segment.target: The new App-V 5.0 project template is saved in the directory specified in step 3 of this procedure.

segment.source: To apply a project template
segment.target: To apply a project template

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Creating a virtual application package using a project template in conjunction with a Package Accelerator is not supported.
segment.target: Creating a virtual application package using a project template in conjunction with a Package Accelerator is not supported.

segment.source: To start the App-V 5.0 sequencer, on the computer that is running the sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V 5.0 sequencer, on the computer that is running the sequencer, click StartAll ProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To create or upgrade a new virtual application package by using an App-V 5.0 project template, click FileNew From Template.
segment.target: To create or upgrade a new virtual application package by using an App-V 5.0 project template, click FileNew From Template.

segment.source: To select the project template that you want to use, browse to the directory where the project template is saved, select the project template, and then click Open.
segment.target: To select the project template that you want to use, browse to the directory where the project template is saved, select the project template, and then click Open.

segment.source: Create the new virtual application package.
segment.target: Create the new virtual application package.

segment.source: The settings saved with the specified template will be applied to the new virtual application package that you are creating.
segment.target: The settings saved with the specified template will be applied to the new virtual application package that you are creating.
